priorVersion.title: Lab Test or Examination Short Name.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBTESTCD

self.title: Lab Test or Examination Short Name

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in LBTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in LBTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). LBTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "ALT", "LDH".
datasetVariables.label: Lab Test or Examination Short Name
datasetVariables.name: LBTESTCD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C67154

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBTEST

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Note: Any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test. The value in LBTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Alanine Aminotransferase", "Lactate Dehydrogenase".
datasetVariables.label: Lab Test or Examination Name
datasetVariables.name: LBTEST

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C181175

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBTSTCND

datasetVariables.description: Identifies any planned condition imposed by the assay system on the specimen at the time the test is performed.
datasetVariables.label: Test Condition
datasetVariables.name: LBTSTCND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBBDAGNT

datasetVariables.description: The textual description of the agent that is binding to the entity in the LBTEST variable. The LBBDAGNT variable is used to indicate that there is a binding relationship between the entities in the LBTEST and LBBDAGNT variables, regardless of direction. \n LBBDAGNT is not a method qualifier. It should only be used when the actual interest of the measurement is the binding interaction between the 2 entities in LBTEST and LBBDAGNT. In other words, the combination of LBTEST and LBBDAGNT should describe the thing, the entity, or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables. \n The binding agent may be (but is not limited to) a test article, a portion of the test article, a related compound, or an endogenous molecule.
datasetVariables.label: Binding Agent
datasetVariables.name: LBBDAGNT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C102580

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from LBORRES in a standard format or standard units. LBSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in LBSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in LBORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in LBSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". For other examples, see Original and Standardized Results.
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: LBSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from LBSTRESC. LBSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: LBSTRESN

datasetVariables.name: LBSTNRLO

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBNRIND

datasetVariables.description: Indicates where the value falls with respect to reference range defined by LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI, LBSTNRLO and LBSTNRHI, or by LBSTNRC. Examples: "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL", "HIGH", "LOW". Sponsors should specify in the study metadata (Comments column in the Define-XML document) whether LBNRIND refers to the original or standard reference ranges and results. LBNRIND is not used to indicate clinical significance.
datasetVariables.label: Reference Range Indicator

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (LBTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable. Represented as ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by LBTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by LBTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: LBELTM

description: A findings domain that contains laboratory test data such as hematology, clinical chemistry and urinalysis. This domain does not include microbiology or pharmacokinetic data, which are stored in separate domains.

name: LB
